```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

M <- read.csv("datasets/M.csv",sep=",")
basic <- read.csv("datasets/basic.csv",sep=",")
glob <- read.csv("datasets/global.csv",sep=",")

```


```{r global_analysis, fig.cap="Analysis global", include=TRUE}

excl <- names(glob) %in% c("run", "density","step","utility_function")
glob <- glob[,!excl] %>% group_by(fraction_blue,circle_blue,circle_orange,eth_con,val_lib,eth_lib,val_con,determinism) %>% summarise_all(mean)




```

```{r M_analysis, fig.cap="Integrationist comparison, M", include=TRUE}

excl <- names(M) %in% c("run", "density","step")
M <- M[,!excl] %>% group_by(fraction_blue,circle_blue,circle_orange,dominant_con,M_con,eth_con,val_con,dominant_lib,M_lib,val_lib,eth_lib,determinism) %>% summarise_all(mean)

# baseline: dominant_con/lib = 1
# compare heatmap: hold dominant_con = 1, dominant_lib = 0.5, heatmap: y-axis = M_lib, x-axis= determinism. However, works more for liberals from the logic of agents' behavior

```
